meanings.meaning: 1. suffix indicating room size (following a number of tatami mats and a counter)
敷 【じき】

meanings.type: Noun, used as a suffix, Noun, used as a prefix, Noun
meanings.meaning: 1. spreading; laying out; covering
2. security deposit Abbreviation, See also 敷金
3. Japanese mattress Abbreviation, See also 敷き布団
敷 【しき】
1. site; plot; lot; grounds
1. site; plot; lot; grounds
1. to spread out; to lay out 私は、ポーチに敷く木製のデッキパネルを購入したいと思います。I would like to purchase a wooden deck panel that can be laid on the porch.
2. to cover その床には厚いじゅうたんが敷いてある。The floor is covered with a thick carpet.
3. to lay (e.g. railway tracks)
4. to sit on
5. to take a position

6. to impose widely (e.g. over a city) See also 法令を敷く禁酒法のしかれていた時代に、酒類密輸入の悪どい商売を腕ずくで自分の支配下におくために、てき屋たちは、おたがいに殺しあっていた。During prohibition days, racketeers used to rub each other out to get control of the rum-running racket.
布く 【しく】
1. to spread out; to lay out 私は、ポーチに敷く木製のデッキパネルを購入したいと思います。I would like to purchase a wooden deck panel that can be laid on the porch.
2. to cover その床には厚いじゅうたんが敷いてある。The floor is covered with a thick carpet.
3. to lay (e.g. railway tracks)
4. to sit on
5. to take a position

6. to impose widely (e.g. over a city) See also 法令を敷く禁酒法のしかれていた時代に、酒類密輸入の悪どい商売を腕ずくで自分の支配下におくために、てき屋たちは、おたがいに殺しあっていた。During prohibition days, racketeers used to rub each other out to get control of the rum-running racket.
布く 【しく】

sentences.translation: I would like to purchase a wooden deck panel that can be laid on the porch.
The floor is covered with a thick carpet.
During prohibition days, racketeers used to rub each other out to get control of the rum-running racket.
